medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain and swelling on the left side of the neck.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient underwent ICD placement 12 weeks prior, after which he experienced transient pins and needles in the left hand. Five weeks after the procedure, he awoke with headache and neck pain on the left side. The pain persisted throughout the day accompanied by numbness and tingling in the left fingertips, along with shooting pains in the left arm and toes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, dyslipidemia, coronary artery disease with two anterior ST-segment elevation myocardial infarctions, asthma requiring intubations and glucocorticoids, history of testicular cancer treated with orchiectomy and chemotherapy, erosive esophagitis, and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hypertension and diabetes. No reported family history of coronary artery disease or cardiomyopathy.
medical_history.social_history: Smoking half a pack of cigarettes per day since age 16, history of marijuana use, binge drinking complicated by pancreatitis, cocaine use (abstinent for the past 3 years). Disabled and has not worked since his first myocardial infarction.
